Author: SRV#9449
Content: Sup. Learning about Komodo. Just found out our about the 64 dpow nodes. Doesn’t this make Komodo centralised and stoppable. Any thoughts?

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: @SRV dPoW nodes (notaries) are elected by those that hold KMD and can be anyone (literally) and as such does not "centralized" make

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: if anything, the fact that any "Joe off the street" can become a notary is the opposite of centralized

Author: SRV#9449
Content: @ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢 but the 64 notaries can be taken out, blackmailed, killed, threatened etc?

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: and that's different from making the same argument about a handful of pools controlling any chain (BTC being an example)?

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: If you can corrupt 64 unconnected individuals, then surely your time and money would be better spent corrupting the 6 people that "control" BTC pools

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: blocks will continue even without notaries

Author: SRV#9449
Content: You can’t turn btc off. If all the miners stopped today, the mining difficulty would drop and pc mining would start again,

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: notaries dont have any monopoly power to create blocks

Author: SRV#9449
Content: Oh wow hello sir.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: hello

Author: SRV#9449
Content: What power do the 64 notaries have above a non notary? What authority/power do they have over and above someone like me with a small holding

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: they can notarize

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: they can also each mine approx 1% of blocks

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but anybody is able to become a notary as the elections are an open process

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and the technically capable ones tend to win the open spots

Author: jorian#4555
Content: as a notary myself, i don't have a lot of power. i dedicate time to make sure my node is up and in good shape to help secure the KMD network by dPoW. apart from that i don't have any more power than any other KMD holder

Author: jorian#4555
Content: i can try to sabotage the network, but we have plenty of smart people who would notice. and then it's 63 against 1 and i'm out. don't want to take that risk

Author: SRV#9449
Content: Appreciate your answers. Thank you.

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: _almost wishes that notaries would go corrupt, the chain would fork, and he would pick up an extra percentage of valid blocks 😝_
